bill_title: to provide the director of insurance rule-making authority to require proper disclosure and prohibit misrepresentation of life insurance policies.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide the director of insurance rule-making authority to require proper disclosure and prohibit misrepresentation of life insurance policies. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 58-33 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The director of insurance may promulgate rules pursuant to chapter 1-26 to promote the proper disclosure of the terms and conditions of life insurance policies and to prohibit the misrepresentation of life insurance policies through the establishment of minimum standards for the advertisement and solicitation of life insurance. The rules may include prohibitions on certain marketing methods or may require disclosures of information to insureds or prospective insureds. In setting the standards, the director shall consider the models adopted by the National Association of Insurance Commissioners, including the Life Insurance Illustrations Model Regulation. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.015 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide the director of insurance rule-making authority to require proper disclosure and prohibit misrepresentation of life insurance policies. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 58-33 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The director of insurance shall promulgate rules pursuant to chapter 1-26 to promote the proper disclosure of the terms and conditions of life insurance policies and to prohibit the misrepresentation of life insurance policies through the establishment of minimum standards for the advertisement and solicitation of life insurance. The rules may include prohibitions on certain marketing methods or may require disclosures of information to insureds or prospective insureds. In setting the standards, the director shall consider the models adopted by the National Association of Insurance Commissioners, including the Life Insurance Illustrations Model Regulation. BILL HISTORY January 27 - First read in House and referred to Commerce. H.J. 153 January 30 - Scheduled for hearing. February 4 - Scheduled for hearing. February 4 - Passed as amended, AYES 12, NAYS 0. H.J. 288

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide the director of insurance rule-making authority to require proper disclosure and prohibit misrepresentation of life insurance policies. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 58-33 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The director of insurance shall promulgate rules pursuant to chapter 1-26 to promote the proper disclosure of the terms and conditions of life insurance policies and to prohibit the misrepresentation of life insurance policies through the establishment of minimum standards for the advertisement and solicitation of life insurance. The rules shall provide for illustration formats, prescribe standards to be followed when illustrations are used, and specify the disclosures that are required in connection with illustrations. In setting the standards, the director shall consider the models adopted by the National Association of Insurance Commissioners, including the Life Insurance Illustrations Model Regulation . BILL HISTORY 1/27/97 First read in House and referred to Commerce. H.J. 153 1/30/97 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/4/97 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/4/97 Commerce Do Pass Amended, AYES 12, NAYS 0. H.J. 288 2/12/97 Motion to Amend. H.J. 445 2/12/97 House of Representatives Do Pass Amended, AYES 67, NAYS 2. H.J. 445
